8418372419c26de6e46a62d8277da863.originalText:
being

This is the interface for the state machine. The interface takes in a few generic parameters:

- EventPayloadMapping: A mapping of events to their payloads.
- Context: The context of the state machine. (which can be used by each state to do calculations that would persist across states)
- States: The states of the state machine. (all of the possible states that the state machine can be in)

The template abstract class TemplateStateMachine implements the basic functionality of the state machine:

- switchTo: A function that allows you to switch the state of the state machine.
- happens: A function that allows you to trigger an event on the state machine.
- onStateChange: A function that allows you to register a callback that will be called when the state of the state machine changes.
- onHappens: A function that allows you to register a callback that will be called when an event is triggered on the state machine.

2f9fc860b0a2a30417181f5722c7d67a.humanReadablePath: BaseCamera > getTransform > getTransform > translation block comments > index-0 > text
2f9fc860b0a2a30417181f5722c7d67a.originalText:
The order of the transformation is as follows:
1. Scale (scale the context using the device pixel ratio)
2. Translation (move the origin of the context to the center of the canvas)
3. Rotation (rotate the context negatively the rotation of the camera)
4. Zoom (scale the context using the zoom level of the camera)
5. Translation (move the origin of the context to the position of the camera in the context coordinate system)

2a0156bddff45cd87f51905d53443f12.originalText:
Alternatively you can import the board class as from a subdirectory; this shaves the bundle size a bit but not a lot though. As the board is the overall entry point for the library.
This is a new line.

091f6e64d42528e777e942d82673fc09.humanReadablePath: Board > alignCoordinateSystem > alignCoordinateSystem > translation comments > index-0 > text
091f6e64d42528e777e942d82673fc09.originalText: This is an attribute that determines if the coordinate system should be aligned with the one of the HTML canvas element. The default is true.

d56f595bfa8e732421ce6ee1d6ab29e4.humanReadablePath: Board > camera > camera > translation comments > index-0 > text
d56f595bfa8e732421ce6ee1d6ab29e4.originalText:
The underlying camera of the board. The camera of the board can be switched.
The boundaries are based on camera. Meaning you can have camera with different boundaries, and you can switch between them during runtime.

12df871a92c067653b182c38fc9637a1.humanReadablePath: Board > context > context > translation comments > index-0 > text
12df871a92c067653b182c38fc9637a1.originalText: The context used to draw stuff on the canvas.

b2414caa591ef021351147b41e57d659.humanReadablePath: Board > fullScreen > fullScreen > translation comments > index-0 > text
b2414caa591ef021351147b41e57d659.originalText:
Determines if the board should be full screen. If this is set to true, the width and height of the board will be set to the window's inner width and inner height respectively.
If set to true the width and height of the board will resize with the window.

c9c9239b332a2578e4fbaa2e02f09563.humanReadablePath: Board > height > height > translation comments > index-0 > text
c9c9239b332a2578e4fbaa2e02f09563.originalText:
This is in sync with the canvas height and the camera view port height. This is not the board's height.
If the limitEntireViewPort is set to true, the min zoom level is updated based on the height.

adc5f1528e2a70244146a7526171b5ad.humanReadablePath: Board > kmtStrategy > kmtStrategy > translation comments > index-0 > text
adc5f1528e2a70244146a7526171b5ad.originalText:
The strategy used to handle the keyboard, mouse events. The default strategy is the DefaultBoardKMTStrategy. 
You can implement your own strategy by implementing the BoardKMTStrategy interface.

baf78a3850e59d432e9b02050fc06bcc.humanReadablePath: Board > limitEntireViewPort > limitEntireViewPort > translation comments > index-0 > text
baf78a3850e59d432e9b02050fc06bcc.originalText:
Determines the behavior of the camera when the camera is at the edge of the boundaries. If set to true, the entire view port would not move beyond the boundaries.
If set to false, only the center of the camera is bounded by the boundaries.

8e185c46c05069c59992621d1094513e.humanReadablePath: Board > maxHalfTransHeight > maxHalfTransHeight > translation comments > index-0 > text
8e185c46c05069c59992621d1094513e.originalText: The max translation height of the camera. This is the maximum distance the camera can move in the vertical direction.

562af3a662fbd21a66f02a4dd76707bd.humanReadablePath: Board > maxHalfTransWidth > maxHalfTransWidth > translation comments > index-0 > text
562af3a662fbd21a66f02a4dd76707bd.originalText: The max translation width of the camera. This is the maximum distance the camera can move in the horizontal direction.

d5f6457608401914a19cb61a19a569a0.humanReadablePath: Board > touchStrategy > touchStrategy > translation comments > index-0 > text
d5f6457608401914a19cb61a19a569a0.originalText:
The strategy used to handle touch events. The default strategy is the DefaultTouchStrategy.
You can implement your own strategy by implementing the BoardTouchStrategy interface.

a36b65df37875a9724b158f5cf3fea0e.humanReadablePath: Board > width > width > translation comments > index-0 > text
a36b65df37875a9724b158f5cf3fea0e.originalText:
This is in sync with the canvas width and the camera view port width. This is not the board's width.
If the

5bb655852fd7a8f9be777d16a09c9a6f.humanReadablePath: Board > width > width > translation comments > index-2 > text
5bb655852fd7a8f9be777d16a09c9a6f.originalText: is set to true, the min zoom level is updated based on the width of the canvas.

37e7405bc4504da1fececf054574cfa4.humanReadablePath: Board > convertWindowPoint2WorldCoord > convertWindowPoint2WorldCoord > translation comments > index-0 > text
37e7405bc4504da1fececf054574cfa4.originalText: Converts a point from window coordinates to world coordinates.

b44d526ebbc4658fb0b34efcda99bacb.humanReadablePath: Board > on > on > translation comments > index-0 > text
b44d526ebbc4658fb0b34efcda99bacb.originalText: Add an camera movement event listener. The events are "pan", "zoom", and "rotate".

85a10a68578175ba0509a51cca3fcfe9.humanReadablePath: Board > onInput > onInput > translation comments > index-0 > text
85a10a68578175ba0509a51cca3fcfe9.originalText:
Add an input event listener. The events are "pan", "zoom", and "rotate". This is different from the camera event listener as this is for input events. 
Input event does not necesarily mean that the camera will move. The input event is the event that is triggered when the user interacts with the board.

bb04eca83792b1dd54dc476ab2f57ac9.humanReadablePath: Board > setup > setup > translation comments > index-0 > text
bb04eca83792b1dd54dc476ab2f57ac9.originalText: This function is used to set up the board. It adds all the event listeners and starts the resize observer and the attribute observer.

3fd9d4fc47652f89273a89e6cb99e144.humanReadablePath: Board > step > step > translation comments > index-0 > text
3fd9d4fc47652f89273a89e6cb99e144.originalText: This is the step function that is called in the animation frame. This function is responsible for updating the canvas context and the camera state.

00c5423d1a2226229cc49d32c926f65a.humanReadablePath: Board > tearDown > tearDown > translation comments > index-0 > text
00c5423d1a2226229cc49d32c926f65a.originalText: This function is used to clean up the board. It removes all the event listeners and disconnects the resize observer and the attribute observer.

The order of the transformation is as follows:
1. Scale (scale the context using the device pixel ratio)
2. Translation (move the origin of the context to the center of the canvas)
3. Rotation (rotate the context negatively the rotation of the camera)
4. Zoom (scale the context using the zoom level of the camera)
5. Translation (move the origin of the context to the position of the camera in the context coordinate system)
